C. Passing on to others your meaning and intent.

Questions.QuestionString: 183. Assertiveness is:
Answers: A. The willingness to actively participate or the ability to state and maintain individual position.
B. The willingness to actively participate, and the ability to state individual position
C. The willingness to actively participate, and the ability to state and maintain individual position

Questions.QuestionString: 184. What type of Hazards can be expected in Aviation Maintenance
Answers: A. Noise, Confined Space, Height, Excessive Temperature, Harmful Substances
B. Noise, Confined Space, Height, Excessive Temperature
C. Noise, Height, Excessive Temperature, Harmful Substances

Questions.QuestionString: 190. When blind rivets which are used for repair work on the aircraft ?
Answers: A. At the locations in an aircraft structure, which are need the heavy load
B. At the locations in an aircraft structure, which are need the light load

C. At the locations in an aircraft structure, which are very hard to reach for riveting - it is impossible to
set a rivet snap at the other site of the rivet

Questions.QuestionString: 191. Which type of solid rivet may used in tank sealing rivets ?

195. A commonly-used rule of thumb for selecting the rivet size is to choose a rivet whose diameter is
?
Answers: A. At least 2 times the thickness of the thickest sheet being joined.
B. At least 2.5 times the thickness of the thickest sheet being joined.
C. At least 3 times the thickness of the thickest sheet being joined.

Questions.QuestionString: 196. Symbol of solid rivet 2017 Aluminium Alloy (AD) ?

Questions.QuestionString: 197. Symbol of solid rivet 2017 Aluminium Alloy (D) ?

C. They are identified by two raised dashes on their heads.

Questions.QuestionString: 199. Symbol of Titanium rivets are identified on their head ?

Questions.QuestionString: 200. Symbol of Corrosion Resistant Steel rivets are identified on their head ?
Answers: B. A small dimple in the centre of their head

Questions.QuestionString: 227. What is definition of thermocouple correct?
Answers:
A. The thermocouple consists of two different metal alloys soldered or welded together in which a
minimal electrical potential is created when the wiring contact is heated which is proportional to the
temperature

B. The thermocouple consists of two different metal alloys soldered or welded together in which a
minimal electrical potential is created when the wiring contact is heated which is inversely proportional
to the temperature

C. The thermocouple consists of two different metal alloys soldered or welded together in which a
minimal electrical potential is created when the wiring contact is heated which is proportional to the
humidity

Questions.QuestionString: 228. What is a function of Coaxial cables?

C. For the transmission of low-frequency signals

Questions.QuestionString: 229. What elements do the current capacity of wires depend on?

B. The insulation and the wire size

Questions.QuestionString: 273. In the galvanic series, the most noble metal will, if joined to another metal. (Level 3)

Questions.QuestionString: 277. In a Galvanic Cell made from Zn (Anode) and Cu (Cathode), which electrode is oxidized

thickness of the metal sheet. If not repaired, what kind of corrosion is most likely to occur?
279. Name one method of corrosion protection that uses electrochemical reactions

280. During routine aircraft maintenance, a fuel sample is usually taken for inspection. One of the
purposes of this is to prevent corrosion in the fuel tank. Why?
Answers:
A. Because in the fuel tank may have water and microorganisms can grow in the tank. This will cause
corrosion of the fuel tank structure

B. Because the fuel in the tank can be mixed with the electrolyte solution, leading to electrochemical
corrosion

C. Because the fuel in the tank can change its chemical structure, turning it into structural corrosive
substances

Questions.QuestionString:
281. In 2 metal joints:
1: between aluminum alloy 2024 and tin,
2: between 2024 and Zinc.
In which joints aluminum alloy 2024 will be corroded first after a period of working time
Answers: A. In the joint between 2024 and Tin
B. In the joint between 2024 and Zinc
